Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with leather, underbrush and blue flower on this earthy red. Made entirely with Sangiovese, the medium-bodied palate offers prune, blood orange vanilla and game alongside dusty, drying tannins. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casale Daviddi 2015 Camaione  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Rose, graphite and oak-driven aromas are front and center. The medium-bodied palate opens with prune, licorice and coffee bean before close-grained tannins shut it down with an astringent, tongue-drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Del Cerro 2016 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of weedy underbrush and leather lead the nose along with whiffs of dark culinary spice. The medium-bodied palate is rather light on its feet, offering mature black cherry, prune and licorice alongside fresh acidity and dusty tannins that leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gattavecchi 2016 Riserva dei Padri Serviti  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: There's an array of unique qualities to the nose of this bottling, where aromas of muddled strawberry, light licorice, wet soil and dusty herbs arise. The palate is loaded with mace and nutmeg spice, which lifts the dried cranberry and wet clay core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Oak Mountain 2017 Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: French oak aromas take center stage along with whiffs of camphor and underbrush. On the austere palate, assertive, close-grained tannins accompany raisin, orange rind, licorice and coffee bean while a note of powdered sage marks the astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindella 2017 I Quadri  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of burned rubber, violet and toasted nut mingle together on this Sangiovese along with a whiff of camphor. On the dense palate, the heat of alcohol accompanies prune, dried cherry and coffee bean before grainy, drying tannins leave and astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Canneto 2015 Casina di Doro  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: With 2% Merlot, this wine is thick and meaty in baked plum and strawberry. A juicy, vibrant midpalate helps to temper the earthy rusticity and dusty tannin.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2016 Voyager Vineyard Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

Description: This light-bodied wine is dry, clean and refreshing. Crisp acidity and a little nip of tannin give it a very lively texture that carries lean plum and peach flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rootdown 2019 Jane's Vineyard Rosé of Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: French oak, menthol and rose aromas slowly form in the glass. On the rather lean, austere palate, vanilla, espresso and candied notes accent a dried cherry core while close-grained tannins leave a dusty, drying finish. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Del Cerro 2017 Silineo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Reduced and waxy, with an enduring earthiness, this red is robust in oak and body weight, with brawny black fruit at its core. Baked plum and tobacco play around dry, supple tannins that add length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Trentadue 2018 Shoestring Vineyard Estate Sangiovese (Alexander Valley)

Description: This medium- to full-bodied wine shows smoky, earthy aromas and a good blackberry-raspberry core flanked by moderate tannins. It's on the hearty, rustic side of the spectrum.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2018 Organic Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Description: Thick tannins gird a palate of dried herb, cedar and oak in this earthy, rustic wine, dipped in lavender and a hint of black licorice. The oak is chewy and pronounced.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Imagery 2017 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Thick and tannic, this substantial red is given 10 months in American oak, the barrels neutral. Meaty and rustic, it offers notes of cranberry, plum and tobacco.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pedroncelli 2018 Alto Vineyards Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese and aged in 25 hectoliter casks, this has classic varietal aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, violet, new leather and camphor. Full-bodied and elegantly structured, the firm palate delivers dried black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco set against a backbone of noble tannins. It's well-balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria San Michele a Torri 2016 Tenuta La Gabbiola Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Enticing aromas of iris, tobacco, and red-skinned berries lead the nose. The balanced, juicy palate offers red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Monterinaldi 2016 Vigneto Boscone  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, fragrant blue flowers, French oak and baked plum take shape in the glass. On the elegant, lithe palate, taut, fine-grained tannins accompany dried cherry, licorice, vanilla, coconut and orange zest before finishing on an espresso note. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Felsina 2017 Colonia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Enticing aromas of violet, eucalyptus and leather lead the nose. The fragrant, structured palate delivers black cherry, clove, tobacco and cinnamon alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it well-balanced. Enjoy 2022–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Bossi 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of leather, menthol, wild berries and dark spice along with a whiff of violet are front and center in this savory red. On the elegantly structured, medium-bodied palate, taut, refined tannins support juicy Marasca cherry, ripe plum, tobacco and licorice. Bright acidity provides focus and balance. Drink 2022–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa Emma 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Fragrant purple flowers, ripe plum, new leather and baking spice are some of the aromas you'll find on this inviting red. Juicy and savory, the medium-bodied palate delivers succulent Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, cinnamon and licorice alongside taut, fine-grained tannins that give it a velvety feel. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria di Petroio 2015 Poggio ai Grilli Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue flower, French oak and menthol aromas fill the glass on this fragrant red. Made with organically grown Sangiovese, the focused palate offers juicy Morello cherry, cassis and espresso alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Molino di Grace 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of fragrant purple flowers, baked plum and a whiff of pipe tobacco form the inviting nose. Elegantly structured, the youthfully austere palate features dried black cherry, licorice and orange zest framed in tightly wound, fine-grained tannins. It closes on a coffee bean note. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2017 CeniPrimo Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue flower, baking spice and ripe plum aromas lead the way on this medium-bodied red along with whiffs of French oak. Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, the taut, structured palate features ripe Marasca cherry, coconut, star anise and espresso alongside close-grained, rather drying tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Molino di Grace 2016 Il Margone Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of fragrant purple flowers and baked plum along with a whiff of oak-driven spice form the alluring nose. The juicy, savory palate is both chewy and polished, delivering ripe Marasca cherry, licorice and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Meleto 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Red berry, rose, slate and camphor aromas are front and center on this 100% Sangiovese. Linear and elegantly structured, the medium-palate offers dried cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean framed in fine-grained tannins before closing on an almost salty note. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2017 Colledilà Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Red berry, rose, slate and camphor aromas are front and center on this 100% Sangiovese. Linear and elegantly structured, the medium-palate offers dried cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean framed in fine-grained tannins before closing on an almost salty note. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2017 Colledilà Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Spice, rose and wild berry aromas waft out of the glass. On the austere palate, polished tannins elegantly support cranberry, sour cherry, espresso and licorice. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2017 Roncione Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of leather, camphor and black-skinned berry. The savory palate offers blackberry, green peppercorn and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2016 Vigna Bastignano Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, sunbaked earth, leather and camphor aromas shape the nose. On the chewy, full-bodied palate, firm tannins support fleshy black cherry, licorice and tobacco. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cafaggio 2015 Basilica Solatio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, truffle, fragrant blue flower and baked plum aromas make their way to the forefront along with whiffs of toasted nut. The wine is made with organically farmed Sangiovese, and its smooth, savory palate features fleshy black cherry, crushed raspberry, licorice and tobacco. Velvety tannins provide supple support while fresh acidity keeps it bright. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria di Corsignano 2016 La Coppia  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of rose petal, red-skinned berry and underbrush lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers sour cherry, red currant and cinnamon alongside bright acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Sala 2016 Il Torriano Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Classic varietal aromas recalling fragrant blue flower, dark-skinned berries, leather and tilled earth shape the nose on this 100% Sangiovese along with a whiff of crushed mint. It's medium-bodied and smooth, featuring ripe Marasca cherry, plum and tobacco set against taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cafaggio 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue flower, red berry, star anise and wet stone aromas are front and center. On the elegant, medium-bodied palate, fine-grained tannins accompany mature Morello cherry, licorice and a hint of tobacco. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa al Vento 2017 Aria  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Earthy and structured, this has aromas suggesting forest floor, new leather and ripe berry. The juicy, solidly built palate offers black cherry extract, licorice and coffee bean framed against assertive, rather grainy tannins. It closes on a note of rusty nail. Drink 2021–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa Emma 2016 Vignalparco Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, French oak, leather and camphor aromas waft out of the glass alongside a hint of violet. The full-bodied palate features dried black cherry, coconut, licorice and espresso alongside firm, close-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca delle Macìe 2015 Sergio Zingarelli Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese planted in high-altitude vineyards, this has aromas of violet, new leather, menthol and French oak. The medium-bodied palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, espresso and licorice alongside fresh acidity and fine-grained, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Fonterutoli 2017 Badiòla Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, Mediterranean scrub and leather come together on this. The savory palate offers black currant, cinnamon and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa a Sesta 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of cedar, forest floor and black-skinned berries emerge from the glass. The savory, balanced palate offers juicy black cherry, raspberry jam, tobacco and white pepper alongside fresh acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2016 Mocenni 89 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of violet, scorched earth and cooking spice emerge from the glass. The firm, balanced palate offers ripe blackberry, licorice and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2022–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo Scopeto 2016 Vigna Misciano Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue flower, tobacco, new leather and balsamic aromas lift out of the glass. On the supple palate, notes of espresso and star anise accompany fleshy black cherry and ripe plum. Fine-grained tannins provide polished support. Showing the heat of the vintage, this is already hitting its ideal drinking window. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Albola 2017 Santa Caterina Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Violet, leather, underbrush and dark-skinned berry aromas take shape in the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers dried Morello cherry, orange zest and espresso alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Meleto 2016 Vigna Casi Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, fennel seed and toasted nuts mingle with notes of camphor and new leather. Made with 100% Sangiovese, the medium-bodied palate offers juicy black cherry, orange zest and licorice before finishing on a coffee note. Fine-grained tannins provide polished support. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vecchie Terre di Montefili 2016 Vigna Vecchia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Fragrant purple flower, menthol and spice aromas lift out of the glass. It's linear and elegantly structured, offering ripe Marasca cherry, orange zest, licorice and espresso flavors alongside polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Querciabella 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Blue flower, new leather, sunbaked earth and plum aromas mingle together on this 100% Sangiovese. The wine is made with organically farmed grapes, and its smooth, juicy palate offers fleshy Marasca cherry, star anise and crushed mint alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cafaggio 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with French oak, coconut and purple flowers. Medium-bodied and assertive, the linear palate offers dried cherry, prune, vanilla and roasted coffee bean framed in close-grained tannins that grip the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Fonterutoli 2017 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, cooking spices and leather take shape in the glass. The structured palate presents ripe black cherry, white pepper and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins and surprisingly fresh acidity for the scorching vintage. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Poggerino 2017 Bugialla Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, vanilla and leather shape the nose. The forward, juicy palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and licorice alongside grainy tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Bossi 2016 Berardo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, forest berries and camphor slowly appear in the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers sour cherry, orange zest and tobacco before finishing on a coffee bean note. Polished tannins and fresh acidity provide support. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vecchie Terre di Montefili 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of toasted nuts, leather and violet lead the nose. The full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and licorice alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2016 Vigna Contessa Luisa Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berries, underbrush and mint lead the way. The juicy, already accessible palate offers raspberry jam, white pepper and nutmeg alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2015 Calidonia Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of cedar, mocha and black plum lead the nose. The chewy palate offers blackberry jam, espresso and coconut alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo Scopeto 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of violet, tilled soil and dark-skinned berries. The savory palate offers blackberry, tobacco and black pepper alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Enjoy through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Capraia 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, cedar and mocha emerge from the glass. The chewy palate offers dried black cherry, vanilla and star anise framed in polished tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca di Castagnoli 2016 Stielle Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has aromas of new leather, underbrush and blue flowers. The palate is rather austere, offering dried cherry, prune and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. It closes on a salty note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antico Lamole 2013 Vigna Grospoli  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has a rather subdued nose that eventually reveals suggestions of toasted oak, blue flowers and menthol. The lean, tightly wound palate is quite austere, recalling pomegranate, orange zest, roasted coffee bean and the barest hint of star anise set against assertive, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few years to unwind, then drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Fonterutoli 2017 Vicoregio  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has a rather subdued nose that eventually reveals suggestions of toasted oak, blue flowers and menthol. The lean, tightly wound palate is quite austere, recalling pomegranate, orange zest, roasted coffee bean and the barest hint of star anise set against assertive, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few years to unwind, then drink sooner rather than later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Fonterutoli 2017 Vicoregio  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this has aromas of red-skinned berries, violet and scorched earth. The juicy, no-frills palate offers raspberry, white pepper and nutmeg alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2017 Cappone  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, mocha and vanilla lift out of the glass. The smooth palate offers black plum, orange zest and cinnamon alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Radda 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This offers aromas of forest floor, cooking spices and violet. The palate shows mature black cherry, clove and a dollop of vanilla alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pomona 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas of toasted oak, mocha and baking spice slowly emerge from the glass. The ripe palate offers prune, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy, rather astringent tannins. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa a Sesta 2016 Sorleone Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has aromas of black plum, Mediterranean brush and mocha that carry over to the straightforward palate along with tobacco and polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of game, blue flowers, leather and damp underbrush lead the nose. The extracted palate offers prune, licorice and roasted coffee bean alongside a hint of rusty nail. Grainy tannins leave an assertive, astringent close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Carpineto 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned berries, espresso and cedar. The solid palate offers dried black cherry, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins that grip the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Castellina 2015 Squarcialupi Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Violet, scorched earth and toasted hazelnut aromas emerge from the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, polished tannins accompany ripe black cherry, star anise and a hint of ground clove. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nardi Viticoltori 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Forest floor, leather, mature black-skinned fruit and toasted spice aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of wet fur. On the palate, close-grained tannins accompany prune, dried black cherry, coffee bean and a gamy note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Stinche 2012 Castello di Lamole Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, cooking spices and mocha lead the way. The soft, juicy palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, espresso and star anise alongside supple, polished tannins. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lecci e Brocchi 2013 MCMDXVII Celebrium Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, scorched earth and cedar lead the way. The dense palate presents blackberry jam, licorice and espresso alongside assertive tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Machiavelli 2015 Vigna di Fontalle Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Violet, scorched earth and toasted hazelnut aromas emerge from the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, polished tannins accompany ripe black cherry, star anise and a hint of ground clove. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nardi Viticoltori 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of mocha, toasted hazelnut and scorched earth. The tight palate offers prune, sage and roasted coffee bean alongside grippy tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lornano 2015 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of baked plum and leather with a whiff of blue flowers form the subtle nose. The firm palate offers prune, dried cherry and a hint of clove alongside drying tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pomona 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, grilled herbs and cooking spices. The solid, straightforward palate offers baked plum, clove and mocha alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Setriolo 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: This offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit, roasted coffee bean and toasted oak. On the taut palate, assertive, drying tannins accompany prune, espresso and dried sage. Drink 2022–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2016 Vigna La Fornace Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, cedar and mocha emerge from the glass. The solid palate offers ripe black plum, black pepper and espresso alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio Torselli 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, toasted nut and blue flower aromas take shape in the glass along with whiffs of botanical herb. On the bright, easygoing palate, pliant tannins offer gentle support for juicy black plum, vanilla and a hint of mint. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Querceto di Castellina 2018 L'Aura  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of mocha, toasted oak and baking spice form the nose. The firm palate offers mature black plum, espresso and tobacco alongside assertive, close-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Quercia al Poggio 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has pure, pretty aromas of violet and wild berries. On the easygoing palate, pliant tannins and bright acidity gently lift juicy sour cherry and a hint of baking spice. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Meleto 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of tilled earth, violet and leather mingle with a whiff of red berries on this enjoyable red. It's soft and ready, offering black cherry, licorice and a dollop of espresso alongside rounded tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tolaini 2018 Vallenuova  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of wild cherry, plum and toasted spice notes follow over to the palate along with coconut and coffee bean. Pliant tannins provide the easygoing framework. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Carpineta Fontalpino 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, espresso and dark-skinned fruit emerge from the glass. The mature palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and black pepper alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bocce 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, mocha and underbrush shape the nose. The linear palate offers black plum, roasted coffee bean and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coltifredi 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of truffle, leather, camphor and French oak form the nose. On the brawny palate, the scorching heat of evident alcohol dominates prune, dried cherry, licorice and tobacco. Drying, close-grained tannins provide firm support. Give the tannins a few more years to unclench, then drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ormanni 2015 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Delicate aromas of dark-skinned fruit, baking spice and underbrush slowly emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers black plum, mocha and vanilla alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Poggerino 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: This solid red has aromas suggesting violet, truffle and tobacco. The palate offers ripe black cherry, white pepper and star anise. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antico Borgo di Sugame 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Delicate aromas of cedar, mocha and baking spice eventually unfold in the glass. The straightforward palate offers prune, clove and sage alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa a Sesta 2016 Il Palei  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of blue flowers, moist earth and red berries are front and center on this young Sangiovese. On the light-bodied, no-frills palate, dusty tannins accompany sour cherry, ground clove and a tangy hint of rusty nail. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cafaggio 2018 Single Estate  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Tilled earth, blue flower and new leather aromas lead the way. The linear palate suggests unripe cherry, orange rind and coffee bean alongside drying tannins that leave a lean, assertive finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vignamaggio 2017 Terre di Prenzano  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting cedar, underbrush and mocha form the subtle nose. The densely concentrated, one-dimensional palate recalls clove, espresso and prune alongside closed-grained tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Podere Il Palazzino 2015 Grosso Sanese  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has aromas of underbrush, leather and mature black-skinned fruit. On the no-frills palate, dusty, drying but not very persistent tannins accompany dried cherry and a hint of baking spice.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio Torselli 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Subdued aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee bean and tilled soil slowly emerge from the glass. The tight palate offers roasted coffee bean, prune and a green note of powdered sage alongside assertive tannins that lead to a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Quercia al Poggio 2016 Vigna Le Cataste Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has aromas of espresso, toasted oak and coconut. The dense, monolithic palate recalls baked plum, roasted coffee bean and clove alongside assertive, drying tannins that leave an astringent, drying close. Drink 2022–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio Torselli 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, burnt rubber and leather take center stage. On the palate, hazelnut, vanilla and tobacco accompany dried cherry while grainy, astringent tannins clench the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Stinche 2013 Castello di Lamole  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, burnt rubber and leather take center stage. On the palate, hazelnut, vanilla and tobacco accompany dried cherry while grainy, astringent tannins clench the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Stinche 2013 Castello di Lamole  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Tobacco, leather and mocha aromas mingle together in the glass. The dense palate is lean in terms of fruit richness, offering prune, roasted coffee bean and coconut alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2015 Piegaia Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas of tilled soil, cooking spices and cassis slowly emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers baked plum and vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Machiavelli 2016 Solatio del Tani  (Chianti Classico)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals aromas of dark-skinned fruit, scorched earth and leather. The straightforward palate suggests ripe black plum, sage and baking spice alongside rounded tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Coltifredi 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas suggesting roasted walnut and toasted oak lead the nose along with a hint of eucalyptus. The lean, light-bodied palate offers suggestions of sour cherry, coconut and coffee bean alongside dusty, fleeting tannins that leave a drying, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ruffino 2018 Santedame  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Earthy aromas suggesting damp soil, underbrush and a whiff of game follow over the light-bodied palate with unripe sour cherry and orange zest. Brisk acidity and loose tannins offer fleeting support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio Scalette 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: This has aromas of scorched earth, toasted nut and eucalyptus. The lean palate suggests prune, blood orange and bitter walnut alongside unripe tannins. You'll also note a green note suggesting powdered sage on the abrupt, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vecchie Terre di Montefili 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Truffle, new leather, camphor and fragrant purple flower are just some of the aromas you'll find on this savory, full-bodied red. It's concentrated yet elegant, offering ripe black cherry, licorice and tobacco framed in noble, refined tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink 2021–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cinciano 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with organically cultivated Sangiovese, this bold red has aromas of baked plum, pipe tobacco, new leather and French oak. The full-bodied palate is concentrated yet weightless, delivering black cherry extract, blackberry, licorice and espresso. Close-grained, velvety tannins provide the tight framework. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontodi 2017 Vigna del Sorbo  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this has energizing aromas of crushed mint, cedar, rose and tilled earth. Vibrant and focused, the structured palate delivers juicy black cherry, ripe plum and baking spice alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. It finishes on a licorice note. Give it a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Istine 2018 Vigna Casanova dell'Aia  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of forest floor, blue flower, leather and pipe tobacco shape the nose. The firm palate is youthfully austere, featuring Marasca cherry, orange zest, licorice and botanical herb framed in tightly knit, close-grained tannins that grip the finish. Vibrant acidity provides balance. Needs time. Drink 2025–2033.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Istine 2018 Vigna Cavarchione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of blue flower, spiced plum, new leather and sunbaked earth form the inviting nose on this pure Sangiovese. Made with organically farmed grapes, the smooth, savory palate doles out fleshy black cherry, baking spice and chopped mint alongside velvety tannins that give it a polished texture. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Volpaia 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sporting a gun on the label, this is a powerful Sangiovese, starting with ripe aromas of black currant, blackberry, lavender and toast on the nose. It's thick on the palate, where baked and fresh dark-berry flavors meet with dark cocoa and violet.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Like the Snows of Yesteryear White Hawk Vineyard
Name: Saint K 2019 Like the Snows of Yesteryear White Hawk Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with new leather, scorched earth, pressed blue flower and oak-driven spice. The firm, elegantly structured palate features dried black cherry, licorice and tobacco before a coffee bean close. Close-grained provide support, drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Felsina 2017 Rancia Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with 100% Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of underbrush, cocoa, new leather and sunbaked earth. Aged partly in large casks and partly in terra-cotta amphora, the chewy, rounded palate doles out dried cherry, star anise, tobacco and bitter-almond. Polished tannins provide smooth support. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Montecchio 2015 Pasquino Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Baked plum, vanilla, menthol and fragrant purple-flower aromas shape the alluring nose. Made with organically grown Sangiovese, the densely concentrated palate doles out mature Marasca cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins that give some grip to the finish. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principe Corsini - Villa Le Corti 2016 Zac Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Enticing aromas of violet, tobacco and new leather lead the nose. The savory, balanced palate features black cherry, raspberry jam, star anise and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Enjoy through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dievole 2016 Vigna di Sessina  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of warm spice, French oak, fruitcake and violet are front and center. On the concentrated, firmly structured palate, close-grained tannins envelop flavors of raspberry jam, coconut and baking spice before a coffee-bean close. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2017 Tenuta Tignanello Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this has aromas of underbrush, French oak and dark-skinned fruit. Reflecting the nose, the firm, elegant palate offers coconut, vanilla, French oak and savory Mediterranean herb set against firm, close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Volpaia 2016 Il Puro Casanova Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Rich and extracted aromas of black cherry, caramel and creamy fudge show on the nose of this bottling from the hills above Camarillo, which includes 5% Syrah. The palate is viscous, showing strong flavors of loamy soil, black-plum pudding and fig, wrapped in creamy tannins and toasty wood touches.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Al Lago 2017 Adagio Sangiovese (California)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, sunbaked earth, prune and pipe tobacco shape the nose. The full-bodied, chewy palate doles out mature plum, licorice and toasted hazelnut alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cinciano 2015 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Mature dark-skinned fruit, French oak, coconut and blue-flower aromas are front and center on this 100% Sangiovese. On the linear palate, vanilla, espresso and licorice notes accent a core of black cherry and blackberry extract. Assertive, close-grained tannins provide the framework. It's still very much on its oak and needs time to fully integrate. Drink 2024–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frescobaldi 2016 Tenuta Perano Rialzi Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black plum, leather and cooking spice lead the nose. The concentrated, ripe palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and tobacco alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Nozzole 2015 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of plum, underbrush, tobacco and French oak mingle with a whiff of violet. The enveloping palate features ripe black cherry, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside close-grained, drying tannins that clench the finish. Drink 2021–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tolaini 2016 Vigna Montebello Sette Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This tangy, light-bodied wine shows a particularly vivid coral color, effusive peach and cranberry aromas and bright, crisp flavors. It's very well balanced and food friendly.                      Jim Gordon
Name: LangeTwins 2019 Estate Grown Rosé Sangiovese (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of crushed aromatic herb, incense and sunbaked earth meld with violet on this 100% Sangiovese. The full-bodied, savory palate delivers exotic spice, dried cherry and licorice alongside taut, refined tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cinciano 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of underbrush, camphor, moist earth and mature black-skinned fruit form the nose. On the full-bodied, concentrated palate, close-grained tannins accompany dried black cherry, licorice and roasted coffee bean before a firm, mouthdrying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Verrazzano 2016 Sassello Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with aromas reminiscent of black-skinned berry, scorched earth and leather. The juicy palate offers blueberry, star anise and cinnamon alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello La Leccia 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of ripe plum, pine forest, exotic spice and cedar slowly appear in the glass. Bold and brawny, the palate offers cherry marinated in spirits, prune and licorice alongside velvety, close-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Riecine 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, tobacco and mocha. The concentrated palate shows dried black cherry, clove and licorice alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Lilliano 2017 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: New leather, underbrush, balsamic notes of camphor and iris aromas meld together in the glass. On the austere palate, close-grained, drying tannins accompany dried cherry, blood orange and exotic spice alongside hints of bitter-almond and roasted coffee bean.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Albola 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of ripe plum, pine forest, exotic spice and cedar slowly appear in the glass. Bold and brawny, the palate offers cherry marinated in spirits, prune and licorice alongside velvety, close-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Riecine 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, tobacco and mocha. The concentrated palate shows dried black cherry, clove and licorice alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Lilliano 2017 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cranberry, red-plum-skin, dried red-flower and lively potpourri aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Tart strawberry and cranberry flavors meet with chai spice on the sip, where bright acidity carries into the fresh finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Midnight 2017 Starlight Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of violet, black-skinned berry and Mediterranean brush. The juicy palate offers black cherry, star anise, clove and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Carobbio 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Dark-spice, toasted nut, blue-flower and camphor aromas waft out of the glass. Round and savory, the chewy palate doles out ripe black cherry, star anise and coffee bean alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Riecine 2018  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Ramona Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Italian varieties seem to excel in certain corners of Southern California. This bottling shows candied black plum and berry, with hints of rock, loam and sandalwood on the nose. Very dry tannins frame the sip, where oak and blackberry vie for attention.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chuparosa 2015 Sangiovese (Ramona Valley)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, underbrush and mocha shape the nose. The ripe palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and espresso alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casale dello Sparviero 2016 Paronza Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals plum, blue flower and earthy whiffs of truffle and damp soil. The straightforward, subtle palate is between light and medium bodied, suggesting sour cherry and star anise alongside dusty tannins. It closes on a coffee-bean note. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mazzei 2018 Fonterutoli  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, mocha and baking spice emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lornano 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of underbrush, toasted nut, red berry and blue flower form the nose on this racy sparkler. Made with Sangiovese, the vibrant palate features pomegranate, sour cherry and bread crust alongside persistent, steely beading.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baracchi 2016 Brut Rosé Metodo Classico Sangiovese (Vino Spumante)

Description: This opens with aromas of mocha, French oak and ripe black plum. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, sage and licorice alongside dusty tannins. Enjoy through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bibbiano 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, mocha and baking spice emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lornano 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown Sangiovese, this has aromas of dark-skinned fruit, mocha and baking spice. The firm palate offers ripe black plum, licorice and espresso alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantalici 2016 Baruffo Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas of tilled soil, French oak and roasted coffee bean slowly emerge from the glass. The dense palate features prune, tobacco leaf and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol that dominates the finish. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bibbiano 2016 Vigna del Capannino Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of wild berry, iris and botanical herb lead the nose. On the chewy, accessible palate, supple tannins accompany ripe Marasca cherry, ripe plum and baking spice. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Bossi 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of mocha, dark-skinned fruit and toasted oak. Packed in an excessively heavy bottle, the solid palate offers ripe black plum, espresso and vanilla alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Rosa 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of espresso, toasted oak and coconut. The dense palate offers roasted coffee bean, licorice and clove alongside assertive, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantalici 2016 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, vanilla and cooking spice lead the nose. The dense palate shows clove, espresso and dried blackberry alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Rosa 2017 Ribaldoni  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of graphite, espresso, black-skinned fruit lead the nose. The ripe palate features toasted notes, roasted coffee bean and spiced plum alongside assertive, rather drying tannins. Drink 2021–2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Viticcio 2016 Prunaio Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Black-skinned berry, toasted hazelnut and roasted coffee-bean aromas shape the nose. The easygoing palate shows ripe black plum, vanilla and mocha alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Panzanello 2018 1427  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black plum, leather and ground clove emerge from the glass. The ripe palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and vanilla set alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2015 I Colli Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Mocha, vanilla and a hint of violet lead the nose. The taut palate features clove, espresso and black plum alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa di Monte 2016 Le Capitozze  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of leather and tobacco. The densely concentrated, fleshy palate is already accessible, featuring prune, blackberry extract and licorice set against enveloping tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Querceto 2017 La Corte Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has aromas of scorched earth, leather and black plum. The solid, no-frills palate offers dried black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Astorre Noti 2015 Fattoria di Ruppiano Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas suggesting French oak, coconut, menthol and blue flower lead the nose. It's medium bodied, offering flavors suggesting sour cherry, roasted coffee bean and powdered sage alongside close-grained tannins that leave an astringent close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castelvecchi 2016 Lodolaio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Ripe black-plum, underbrush and menthol aromas shape the nose. The forward palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and a hint of vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Panzanello 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut and camphor are front and center on this 100% Sangiovese. Reflecting the nose, the assertive palate shows raw wood, orange zest, prune and hints of exotic spice alongside grainy, drying tannins. Give the tannins a few more years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later before the remaining fruit dries out.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Querceto di Castellina 2017 Sei Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of coconut, baking spice and toasted oak lead the nose. The tight palate offers blackberry jam, espresso and powdered sage alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Carobbio 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of coconut, espresso and prune carry over to the tight palate along with blackberry extract, roasted coffee bean and powdered sage. Close-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa di Monte 2013 Le Capitozze Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue-flower, plum and menthol aromas form the nose. The medium-bodied palate offers tart sour cherry, powdered sage and aniseed alongside grainy tannins that leave a firm, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nittardi 2018 Casanuova di Nittardi Vigna Doghessa  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, underbrush and roasted coffee bean follow over to the palate, along with prune and aniseed. Close-grained tannins sneak up on the end and leave a drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brancaia 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Cedar, mocha and stewed prune aromas lead the nose. The tight palate offers blackberry jam, coconut and espresso alongside grainy tannins that leave a rather astringent finish. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Trasqua 2012 Nerento Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of mature black-skinned fruit, menthol, French oak and blue flower come to the forefront. Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, the full-bodied, evolved palate shows the heat of the vintage, offering dried cherry, prune and roasted coffee bean while close-grained tannins leave a drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantalici 2017 Baruffo  (Chianti Classico)

Description: An aroma like smoked blackberries leads to rich, plummy, black-fruit flavors and hints of milk chocolate in this full-bodied but non-tannic wine. It's fresh, mouthfilling and easy to swallow.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2019 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Description: This has aromas of toasted oak, sunbaked earth and hints of grilled herb. It shows the heat of the scorching vintage, with flavors of prune and dried cherry accented by roasted coffee-bean notes. Grainy, drying tannins leave a lean, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Molino di Grace 2017  Chianti Classico

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Hints of mint and cedar help give this full-bodied wine a mature, oak-aged, reserve-style personality despite its young age. Medium tannins and rather strong alcohol lend plenty of appetizing grip to the texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lava Cap 2018 Sangiovese (El Dorado)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak and roasted nut follow over to the light-bodied palate along with mature plum and orange rind. Dusty, fleeting tannins leave a rather short, drying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lecci e Brocchi 2018 Ragonaia  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has subdued, earthy aromas suggesting leather, grilled Porcini mushroom, ripe berry and a whiff of violet. Showing the heat of the vintage, it's full bodied, warm and evolved, with flavors reminiscent of dried cherry, prune and coffee bean set against drying tannins that leave an astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lornano 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Camphor, underbrush and graphite aromas form the nose. On the subdued, straightforward palate, dusty tannins accompany suggestions of prune and espresso before an abrupt, drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca delle Macìe 2017 Tenuta Sant'Alfonso  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue-flower, wild-berry and damp soil aromas form the nose. The zesty, straightforward palate suggests sour cherry and star anise alongside dusty tannins before closing on a tinny note. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Vicchiomaggio 2018 Guado Alto  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Botanical herb, leather, truffle and plum aromas meld with a hint of blue flower. Made with organic grapes, the straightforward palate offers prune and tobacco alongside dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantalici 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Botanical herb, leather, truffle and plum aromas meld with a hint of blue flower. Made with organic grapes, the straightforward palate offers prune and tobacco alongside dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantalici 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, mocha and underbrush emerge from the glass. On the dense palate, drying but fleeting tannins accompany prune, orange rind and roasted coffee bean.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casale dello Sparviero 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Vinous aromas of just-pressed grapes mingle with red berry and blue flower on this tangy red. The easygoing palate offers sour cherry and ground clove alongside bright acidity and light tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Albola 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of wild berry and dark spice waft out of the glass. The straightforward palate suggests dried cherry, orange peel, clove and powdered sage alongside dusty, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Melini 2017 Terrarossa  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This soft and frothy wine shows a deep orange color and noticeable sweetness, giving it an easy, straightforward appeal.                      Jim Gordon
Designation: Villa Antico Pétillant Naturel Rosé of
Name: Scotto Family Cellars 2018 Villa Antico Pétillant Naturel Rosé of Sangiovese (Lodi)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: An appealing pale-salmon color, this wine shows a significant amount of reduction out of the gate. The palate is light and bright, with a pleasing zip of acidity.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2019 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A smoky, rubber-boot aroma leads to flavors of graphite, charcoal and sour cherry in this rather raw-tasting and full-bodied wine. No added sulfites.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kwaya 2019 Organic Sangiovese (Mendocino)

Description: Aromas evoking scorched earth, leather, crushed mint and ripe dark-skinned berry lead the way along with whiffs of blue flower. Linear and elegantly structured, the taut palate starts off with dried Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and tobacco before close-grained tannins leave a firm finish. Drink 2023–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Caparzo 2015 Vigna La Casa  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Description: Heady aromas of black-skinned berry, violet and Mediterranean brush form the nose. Made with organically cultivated Sangiovese, the polished, balanced palate doles out ripe black cherry, clove, vanilla and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Maggio 2012 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sangiovese made in a carbonic fashion shows much promise. Clean lines of red currant and raspberry meet with potting soil, white pepper and a hint of game on the nose of this bottling. The palate is impressively layered, offering strong pepper spices and a taut texture against the dark-berry backdrop.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Folktale 2019 Carbonic Sangiovese (Monterey County)

Description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this structured red opens with enticing aromas of violet, black-skinned berry and underbrush. The delicious palate delivers Marasca cherry, raspberry jam, licorice, black pepper and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Enjoy through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Gabbiano 2016 Cavaliere d'Oro Bellezza Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, violet and underbrush. The elegant, bright palate delivers juicy red cherry, cinnamon, star anise and aromatic herb alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Maggio 2013 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Intense aromas of ripe black plum, violet and new leather are front and center. Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, the bold palate offers Marasca cherry, raspberry jam, vanilla and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casina di Cornia 2013 Vigna La Casina Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, leather and cooking spice. The structured palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Cinciole 2015 Aluigi Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this offers aromas of black-skinned berry, espresso and tilled soil. The concentrated palate shows ripe black plum, star anise and mocha alongside firm, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Filigare 2016 Lorenzo Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subtle aromas suggesting ripe black-skinned fruit, used leather and cellar floor slowly take shape in the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, dusty, drying tannins accompany prune, dried cherry and a hint of ground clove.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Belpoggio 2015  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: Underbrush, scorched earth and toasted hazelnut aromas lead the nose. On the rounded, accessible palate, polished tannins accompany dried cherry, roasted almond and a hint of licorice. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Camigliano 2015 Paesaggio Inatteso  (Brunello di Montalcino)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is Sangiovese (86%) and Malbec, with the fruit coming from Boushey and Gamache, respectively. The aromas offer notes of coffee, sautéed herb and chocolate. It's loaded with coffee and cherry flavors. Lightly grainy tannins back it up. It's delicious, but the oak (34% new French) seems to get in the way of the fruit at times.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Sparkman 2018 Baba Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Description: Inviting aromas of red-skinned fruit, underbrush and baking spice emerge from the glass. The savory palate offers red plum, cinnamon and star anise alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Carus 2016 Baldero  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with varietal aromas of violet, cooking spice and underbrush. The easy-drinking, savory palate offers tart red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bibbiano 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this opens with subtle aromas of black-skinned berry, scorched earth and cooking spice. The savory palate offers black cherry, clove and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Cinciole 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: This opens with aromas that suggest forest floor, dark-skinned berry and mocha. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, sage and ground pepper alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Conte Guicciardini 2016 Belvedere Campòli Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese, this robust red opens with aromas of ripe dark-sinned fruit, cedar and cooking spice. The dense palate offers prune, clove and tobacco alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casina di Cornia 2015 Vigna La Casina Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of black plum, tilled earth and cooking spice. The juicy palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside smooth tannins and firm acidity. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Famiglia Nunzi Conti 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Leather, black-skinned berry and a whiff of mocha shape the nose. The ripe palate offers mature black cherry, clove and a hint of white pepper alongside compact tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Montepaldi 2015 Tagliafune Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of dark-skinned fruit, cooking spice and cedar form the nose. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum, clove and baking spice alongside solid tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindi Sergardi 2016 Ser Gardo  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This big rounded red opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, violet and underbrush. Made with organically farmed Sangiovese grapes, the savory, accessible palate offers ripe black plum, tobacco and a hint of star anise alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casina di Cornia 2016 Vigna La Casina  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, mocha and baking spice emerge from the glass. The chewy palate offers Marasca cherry, toasted hazelnut and espresso alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Capraia 2016 Effe 55 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of red-skinned berry, Mediterranean brush and baking spice emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers raspberry jam, cinnamon and clove alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Castellina 2018 Cosimo Bojola  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas of dark-skinned fruit, roasted coffee bean and tilled soil slowly emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum, mocha and clove alongside dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio Bonelli 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas of dark-skinned fruit, roasted coffee bean and tilled soil slowly emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum, mocha and clove alongside dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio Bonelli 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of mocha, toasted hazelnut and baking spice emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum, espresso and clove alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Famiglia Nunzi Conti 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of camphor, leather and culinary spice emerge from the glass. The brooding, solid palate offer blackberry jam, vanilla and sage alongside close-grained tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Montepaldi 2015 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Mocha, dried black-skinned fruit and menthol aromas form the nose. The hearty palate offers blackberry jam, powdered sage and espresso alongside assertive tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Conte Guicciardini 2017 Belvedere Campòli  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has subtle aromas of dark-skinned berry and baking spice. The straightforward medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry and star anise alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Montepaldi 2016 Tagliafune  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This Sangiovese is blended with 7% of Cabernet. There's an abundance of red cherry and plum fruit on the nose, backed by olives, savory spice, hoisin and rose petals. The oak is on the mealy side and struggles to integrate into the wine. Medium to full bodied, the juicy-fruited palate is cinched by spicy tannins and prominent oak.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Alpha Box & Dice 2017 Blood of Jupiter Sangiovese (McLaren Vale)

Description: Aromas of mocha, toasted hazelnut and baking spice emerge from the glass. The straightforward palate offers ripe black plum, espresso and clove alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Famiglia Nunzi Conti 2015 Vigna Elisa Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of scorched earth, toasted nut, used leather and underbrush form the subdued nose. Reflecting the scorching vintage, the evolved, no frills palate shows prune, dried tobacco leaf and a salty note alongside close-grained tannins that leave a mouthdrying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casisano 2015  Brunello di Montalcino

Description: This has subtle aromas evoking dark-skinned berry, mocha and underbrush. The medium-bodied palate offers black plum, star anise and vanilla alongside firm, drying tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Cellese 2015 Sor Bruno Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Subdued aromas of mocha, scorched earth and cedar slowly emerge from the glass. The mature palate offers prune, toasted hazelnut and espresso alongside chewy, evolved tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Cellese 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are unsettled out of the gate, with notes of char and tire rubber. Plump char and cherry flavors follow. The oak plays prominently, even once it opens up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Brian Carter 2015 1 Boushey Vineyard Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Description: This wine has an inviting peach nose and is dry and tannic on the palate. Light bodied yet concentrated, it offers a texture and taste of lemon zest on the finish.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pope Valley Winery 2019 Eakle Ranch Rosé of Sangiovese (Napa Valley)

Description: Subdued aromas of mocha and toasted oak slowly emerge from the glass. The one-dimensional palate offers blackberry, sage and a hint of espresso alongside solid, assertive tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo La Stella 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of barnyard, leather and wet fur lead the way. The aromas carry over to the short, rustic palate together with ripe plum and gamy notes alongside loose, fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Belpoggio 2018  Rosso di Montalcino

Description: Enticing aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, iris, new leather and camphor lead the nose. It's smooth, structured and has great energy for such a hot vintage, offering flavors of dried cherry, raspberry compote, blood orange and tobacco set against taut refined tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Istine 2017 Le Vigne Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this radiant red opens with alluring aromas of iris, perfumed berry, eucalyptus and underbrush. Racy and loaded with youthful tension, the linear palate delivers crushed raspberry, morello cherry, blood orange and licorice while tight, refined tannins and vibrant acidity provide the framework. Drink 2022–2033.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Istine 2018 Vigna Istine  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Fragrant and delicious, this opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flower, leather, underbrush and a whiff of French oak. The full-bodied, enveloping palate delivers baked plum, Marasca cherry, licorice and a note of espresso framed in fine-grained enveloping tannins that give it a smooth texture and a weightless finesse.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontodi 2017  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Elegant aromas of dried berries, crushed cinnamon, warm bread, wet stone and lightly brushed vanilla extract make for a complex nose on this bottling. Strong flavors of blackberry and mulberry paste carry the palate, where leather and cocoa dust ride smooth acidity into the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Old Creek Ranch 2017 White Hawk Vineyard Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Underbrush, tobacco, fragrant purple flower and oak-driven spice form the nose. Savory and enveloping, the alluring palate delivers baked plum, spiced cranberry and star anise while taut fine-grained tannins provide the backbone. It's balanced, with bright acidity. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Bernardi 2016 Sa'Etta Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Dark-skinned fruit, toasted hazelnut, eucalyptus and underbrush aromas form the nose. The medium-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, dried botanical herb and ground clove alongside fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Felice 2016 Il Grigio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of crushed dark-skinned berry, violet, tilled earth and baking spice are front and center on this fragrant red. Racy and loaded with youthful energy, the savory palate features black plum, Marasca cherry and licorice framed in taut polished tannins. Bright acidity keeps it fresh and balanced. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Istine 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: New leather, camphor and blue flower are some of the aromas you'll find on this bright, fragrant red. On the medium-bodied palate, vibrant acidity and taut tannins surround cassis, Marasca cherry and tobacco notes. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Felsina 2018 Berardenga  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of camphor, cassis, scorched earth and violet form the nose of this medium-bodied red. Made with Sangiovese, the smooth palate offers dried Marasca cherry, coconut, vanilla and thyme alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2017 Badia a Passignano Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of ripe black-skinned fruit, leather, forest floor and balsamic hints of eucalyptus. Showing the heat of the vintage, the medium-bodied palate is already somewhat evolved, offering dried black cherry, incense and sandalwood alongside dusty rather drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Felsina 2017 Berardenga Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Earthy aromas of truffle, camphor and blue flower mingle with whiffs of new leather. Smooth and supple, the rounded, savory palate offers fleshy black cherry, baking spice and smooth, polished tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fontodi 2017 Filetta di Lamole  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, dark-skinned berries, leather and eucalyptus aromas come to the forefront. On the linear medium-bodied palate, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity accompany Marasca cherries, blood oranges and a hint of ground cloves. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jacopo Biondi-Santi 2016 Sassoalloro Sangiovese (Toscana)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The carbonic style is powerful and refreshing on the nose of this bottling, which offers raspberry and crushed stone aromas. There is immense amounts of zip to the sip, where crunchy strawberry flavors meet with light herbs.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: So Fresh 2019 Love You Bunches Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Enticingly fragrant, this offers inviting aromas of violet, perfumed berry and a whiff of pipe tobacco. Made with organically grown grapes, the racy palate offers cranberry, blood orange and star anise alongside lithe tannins. Vibrant acidity keeps it balanced and focused. Enjoy through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Bernardi 2018 Retromarcia  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A leafy earthy aroma and traditional olive and grilled plum flavors give this mature wine a tempting Italian flair, while medium to full body and light tannins lend the mouthfeel an mouthwatering grip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2014 AX-1 Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Aromas of camphor, French oak and blue flower lead the nose. The dense, medium-bodied palate offers oak-driven sensations of coconut, vanilla and espresso alongside ripe plum. Fine-grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: San Felice 2016 Poggio Rosso Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This robust and tannic wine exudes sawn oak aromas, and blends both tart and ripe red fruits on the palate. Its grippy texture and concentration give a sense of good aging potential. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2017 Riserva Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Baking-spice aromas and rich but bright red-cherry and strawberry flavors define this well-balanced, medium- to full-bodied wine that is true to its Italian roots. Moderate tannins and good acidity will keep it lively when paired with rich food.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2017 Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Los Olivos District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: A very light shade of yellowish-pink in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of flower petal and light melon on the nose. There's a focused sizzle of acidity to the brisk sip, where baked strawberry flavors reign.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Figge 2019 Rosé of Sangiovese (Los Olivos District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sangiovese is not a common rosé style in California, yet this one shows that it works. Aromas of strawberry, cherry and red apple lead into broad flavors of watermelon and bubblegum, with ample acidity to keep it fresh and lively.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le Vigne 2019 Rosé of Sangiovese (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of light grapefruit peel are fresh and linear on the nose of this sparkling Sangiovese—an uncommon choice. It's tight on the palate with brushes of ripe berry and crushed rocks, proving pleasant if not wildly complex.                      Matt Kettmann
Designation: Machado Creek Vineyard Sparkling Rosé of
Name: Odonata 2018 Machado Creek Vineyard Sparkling Rosé of Sangiovese (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas offer notes of medicine cabinet, cherry and dark raspberry, not seeming entirely integrated. The tannins are bunched up at present. It's hard to tell where it's going.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Novelty Hill 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of watermelon, orange and banana show on the nose of this Sangiovese-based rosé. Tropical flavors of papaya and a bit more banana show on the palate, which finishes with a splash of acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Section Wines 2019 La Luciana Rosé of Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The barrel spice, leather, dried cranberry, tire rubber and dried herb aromas show typicity. There's a pleasant brightness to the tart fruit flavors and firm tannins, backed by lively acidity. There's an Old World sensibility to it, and it will be best enjoyed at the dinner table. Pair it with grilled lamb chops with a cranberry/cherry glaze.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cavatappi 2015 Molly's Cuvée Red Willow Vineyard Sangiovese (Yakima Valley)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This bracing, light-bodied white wine made from red Sangiovese grapes is subdued in terms of its light nutty and herbal flavors, and offers a nervy but neutral expression that won't get in the way of food.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Noceto 2018 Bianco Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: This lightly colored clonal selection of Sangiovese starts with elegant aromas of baked strawberry, cardamom and vanilla on the nose. The palate is suave and smooth in flavors of roasted strawberry and French toast spice, with a firm texture bolstered by just enough acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Robert Renzoni 2016 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring a dazzling sense of detail, with notes of raspberry, cranberry, sweet dried flower and moist earth. Action-packed, dense but not overweighted red-fruit flavors follow. The acidity is bright, and the tannins present but remarkably supple. It's a pitch-perfect example of the variety, with a very long life in front of it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Leonetti Cellar 2017 Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright, fresh aromas of raspberry, cranberry and plum are followed by brawny fruit flavors, backed by firm, lightly grainy tannins. A fine sense of acidity backs it up. It has all of the stuffing but needs time in the cellar for the tannins to stretch their legs. Best after 2023.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2018 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
